pages.text: Evaluate a list of patterns, as if I had drawn them myself with my $(item)Staff/$.$(br)Costs about five $(item)Charged Crystal/$s.

This can be $(italic)very/$ powerful in tandem with $(l:items/focus)$(item)Foci/$; see that entry for my thoughts on the subject.$(br2)It also makes the bureaucracy of Nature a "turing-complete" system, according to one esoteric scroll I found.$(br2)It seems there's a limit to how many times a _Hex can cast itself, to avoid runaway spells.
Cast a _Hex over each element of the second list.$(br)Costs about 10 $(item)Charged Amethyst/$s.

More specifically, for each element in the second list:$(li)Creates a new stack, with everything on the current stack plus that element$(li)Draws all the patterns in the first list$(li)Saves all the iotas on the sub-stack$(br)Then, after all is said and done, pushes all the iotas saved from the sub-stacks onto the main stack.$(br2)No wonder all the practitioners of this art go mad.
